resources.string: Select the type of server you have
If you already have a Firebase account, sign in or create a new one using your Google account at the following link
Once in your Firebase console, you should create a new project (It\'s recommended to keep analytics enabled)
From your Firebase project, add a new app to the project; in this case, it will be an app for Android
In the Android package name field, you should enter
This file contains data that we will use later
Then click Next, Next, and go to the console
Go to the Compilation tab and then select Realtime Database
Create a database, choose the location that suits you best
Configure security rules to be locked down for now
Then, go to Realtime Database rules and configure them as follows so that your data can only be accessed by an authenticated user
Don\'t forget to publish the changes
Go to the Compilation tab and then to Authentication
Add an access provider, in this case, we need to enable the native provider
Do not enable access without a password
Save changes and you\'re all set
Enter the credentials related to the user who will manage the server data
Oops! It seems there\'s an issue with your application ID. Please double-check the ID you\'ve provided and ensure it matches the required format.
It\'s the current_key variable inside your google-services.json file
It\'s located at mobilesdk_app_id within your google-services.json file
It\'s the root address of your Realtime Database

The connection to the database has timed out, and access to data is currently unavailable. Please verify that the database URL is correct, check your internet connection, and ensure you have the necessary permissions.
